org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.mongodb.impl

Class MongoDBDatastoreProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.spi.BaseDatastoreProvider
      • org.hibernate.ogm.datastore.mongodb.impl.MongoDBDatastoreProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, DatastoreProvider, Service, Configurable, ServiceRegistryAwareService, Startable, Stoppable

    public class MongoDBDatastoreProvider
extends BaseDatastoreProvider
implements Startable, Stoppable, Configurable, ServiceRegistryAwareService
    Provides access to a MongoDB instance
    Author:
    Guillaume Scheibel <guillaume.scheibel@gmail.com>, Gunnar Morling
    See Also:

      • getDefaultQueryParserServiceType

        public Class<? extends QueryParserService> getDefaultQueryParserServiceType()
        Description copied from interface: DatastoreProvider
        Returns the type of QueryParserService to be used for executing queries against the underlying datastore.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultQueryParserServiceType in interface DatastoreProvider
        Overrides:
        getDefaultQueryParserServiceType in class BaseDatastoreProvider
        Returns:
        The query parser implementation type of the current dialect or null if the underlying datastore does not support the execution of queries and full-text searches via Lucene / Hibernate Search are to be used instead.

      • getSchemaDefinerType

        public Class<? extends SchemaDefiner> getSchemaDefinerType()
        Description copied from interface: DatastoreProvider
        Returns the type of the SchemaDefiner of this datastore. An instance of this type will be added to the service registry using the SchemaDefiner service role.
        Specified by:
        getSchemaDefinerType in interface DatastoreProvider
        Overrides:
        getSchemaDefinerType in class BaseDatastoreProvider
        Returns:
        the schema definer type

      • allowsTransactionEmulation

        public boolean allowsTransactionEmulation()
        Description copied from interface: DatastoreProvider
        Whether this underlying datastore allows emulation of transactions. When transaction emulation is used, transactions only demarcate a unit of work. The transaction emulation will make sure that at commit time all required changes are flushed, but there are otherwise no true transaction, in particular rollback, semantics.
        Specified by:
        allowsTransactionEmulation in interface DatastoreProvider
        Overrides:
        allowsTransactionEmulation in class BaseDatastoreProvider
        Returns:
        true if the underlying datastore allows transaction emulation, false otherwise.
